website_summaries.verdict: An extremely affordable bow for teens and adults just getting into archery, though it needs a bit of adjustment to fit each archer’s style.
pros: Accurate, quiet shooting with good punch-through power
cons: Arrow rest and sights are substandard
Finish chips off after some use
Significant adjustment needed out of the box

customer_reviews.title: This is a great entry level hunting bow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great entry level hunting bow. it will be perfect for an adult looking to get into bow hunting or for a teenager looking to do the same. this bow is highly adjustable to meet the demands of nearly any shooter. the draw cycle is smooth and it has a solid back wall. it shoots pretty fast and without a doubt will be capable of dispatching any animal you plan to hunt.
customer_reviews.author: Devan Petersen

customer_reviews.title: not for me. too much wobble to handle.
customer_reviews.text: this was horrible for me. the let off is too high. so when I release for a shot there is a big wobble that takes place for my small hands. it pushes my hand forward and side to side too much. Perhaps this is for those with a stronger grip or bigger hands. mine are too weak for this thing. string came very dry. the whole thing was too big and heavy for me to hold up and aim steady. I couldn't even move the string when it was set to 70lbs. I had to crank it down a few turns. I'm going with the SAS Scorpii 55 # compound bow instead. sorry. good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Vivactive

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter bow
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't shot a bow before. I decided I wanted to take up the hobby because a bunch of my friends are into it. I figured this would be a great starter bow. I received it very quickly and took it to Bass Pro to get it set up. I did have to pay a good amount to get it set up...needed a sight, stabilizer, etc. since this was a bare bones bow. Overall, after shooting it twice, I feel like it was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Hammond

customer_reviews.title: The bow that can't be shot!
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box, got all excited, pulled the string back, let go, SNAP! The string snapped and bits of plastic flew everywhere. (Scared the daylights out of my dogs.) I thought "not a problem, I'll get this replaced". Second one comes in, got all excited, pulled the string back, let go, SNAP! Dogs scattered and I'm sitting here like WTF! Why would you sell a bow that can't be shot once fellas? Unsure if I just want my money back or if I should just buy a new string.
customer_reviews.author: matty s.

customer_reviews.title: This is an item that is or would be Hard to beat, Great Buy & Good Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Received it in a short time, it was well packed, it came with all needed parts & some tools, the only mountings were the sights and the arrow rest which was no issue. The instructions could have been a little more in Details both in pictures & word instructions as to the mountings, parts listing and usage. For this kind of compound bow it would be hard to beat with all the features and quality of it's construction for usages. Very satisfied over all, & would recommend it to others interested.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Charmley

customer_reviews.title: For the money great, but there are much better out there.
customer_reviews.text: I got this bow due to my interest in learning Archery. I handed this one down and purchased a much more expensive but better bow. The issues I had with this is the screw on the module kept coming off very easily and the shops I took it to did not really want to work on it because they told me they don't like to work on them. Maybe just my luck?
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie R Funes

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and working bow.
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete bow with all you need (except arrows and arm and finger guards) to begin practicing and eventually hunting. It has adjustable draw weight as well as adjustable draw length. The arrow rest and sight need to be installed but that is easy, although the directions could be more complete regarding those activities. I was a little skeptical when first opened but have tried it and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 Stars for a cheaper model bow.  Mine fell apart on me.  Seller was quick to issue a refund on the defective bow.
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 Stars actually. As the video shows a part fell off after just a uses. This may not be typical of the bow. The bow has good let-off on pull. But the sights are difficult to keep in place, the arrow rest moves, and the string stopper fell out. The seller was excellent and gave us a quick refund. If you cannot afford more than a $150 for a bow this might work for you. But rather than buy accessories I'd save up and got a mid-range bow in the $400 price range.
customer_reviews.author: WildernessLivingWork

customer_reviews.title: Great first time bow for an adult with strength
customer_reviews.text: It looks awesome and feels very sturdy. I purchased just the bow and bought an accessorie kit for 30 bucks. It shoots great. This was my first time doing archery. I hit 10 out of 12 arrows on the target from about 20 feet away. I reduced the weight 4 turns with the allen key. For around $200 I got a bow, accessories,arrows and a target. It was a great deal compared to the prices of the nicer bows.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed, took the bow out back to test it out, pulled and let the arrow loose, something breaks off the bow, goes flying through the open door and breaks my friggin TV, the string freys like crazy and jumps off the cams all on the first draw. Really disappointed, and now out $2100 for a new TV!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn and Shane

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what’s going on with these bows but I ordered one and the string came apart on the 3rd shot and sliced my hand open. They immediately sent a replacement and 5 shots later that string broke too. We even got it on video. I’m ready for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like the arrow rest so I installed a whisker biscuit
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the money. I didn't like the arrow rest so I installed a whisker biscuit. I had the peep sight adjusted and it seems to work great and has plenty of power. Overall it has the capabilities of a much more expensive bow for much less. The only complaint i have is that some of the Allen bolts can come loose. Specifically the one on the string vibration arrester. The arrester will remain attached but has a little play. When tightened, it will loosten easily but still works...just annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I am a newby but I find this bow to be exceptional for the price point. I put a whisker rest and shooting instinctively. I am a big guy so I'm pulling 60#. Put a D-loop on string and shooting a release with trigger. Take the pull screws out and lock tight as I lost one while shooting. I found it in the grass. I wound not hesitate to go hunting with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great Value For A Beginners Bow
customer_reviews.text: This is a good beginners compound bow; it's not a Hoyt, but it's also not junk. It is a great idea to learn the fundamentals of archery using this bow. I would not hunt with this bow, I would not compete with this bow, but I would use this bow to familiarize myself with the principles of archery, then move onto a more expensive bow. You will need to buy a release, i also suggest buying the following; sights, arrow rest, and a quiver. With that set up, you will be on your way to becoming a competent archer.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Supertramp

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bow!!
customer_reviews.text: A little customization and this thing is shooting quiet groups just like you would want any bow doing. I did swap out the rest with a basic QAD and threw some dampeners and string silencers on it. But for the money, this thing is easily worth double what it costs! This is my 14 yr old son’s first hunting bow, he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Great bow and worth the cash
customer_reviews.text: This bow shoots great for me now after some tunning and work on my own form. I do not think this is a good bow for beginners because of the tunning that needs to be done to get good groups. The add said that they come preset at 70lbs but wwhen i had mine checked out at the local archery shop it was 75lbs. This works great for me but im 6ft 245lbs and to lower the poundage is not easy the limbs are screwed in really tight
customer_reviews.author: Tony B

customer_reviews.title: Great Bow for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this bow for beginners and more advanced shooters. Although, you should not use fiber glass arrows unless you want to always be buying new arrows. Fiber glass arrows are too weak for this bow and it destroys them. I've had the best luck with bamboo or wood around 350 grains, aluminum as a last resort. The only bad part about this bow is; the string doesn't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Good bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: The bow in and of itself is great for the price, it performs comparably to more expensive bows for a fracrion of the price. I would buy a better rest (not a fan of drop aways), the one included is cheap and clumsy, drops to slow, my fletching hits it and causes arrow to wable a lot. But after replaceing rest with cheap brush rest the bow is dead on. Sights are cheap but functional so on a budget great. Over all I would defently recommend to anybody looking for a cheap bow to start bow hunting, or target shooting, without having to worry about getting garbage.
customer_reviews.author: joel havird

customer_reviews.title: Great bow. had a site and peep installed
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. had a site and peep installed. bang, bobs your uncle. ya can't miss. (two, maybe three hundred shots so far) quite and smooth (I got a short stabilizer). solid feel. love this bow. fantastic customer service. they fixed my problem (my issue not theirs) and went above and beyond for me. real stand up guy's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best starter bow Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with my pl purchase of this bow. From the look and style, to the quality and price, this bow is amazing! Out the box its ready to go. Wasnt a fan of the sight it came with but that's easily replaced. I will definitely buy a couple more!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. FountainTop Contributor: DC Comics

customer_reviews.title: Slightly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had it for 2 weeks, added all my own new accessories (sight, whisker biscuit, vibration reducers, etc). Seems to shoot straight and true. Maybe 100 arrows through it and the strings around the peep are coming apart already. Have had to retorque most if not all of the hardware, including the screws on the draw length adjustment modules. The documentation that came with it is very vague and dorsn't describe any of the OEM settings (draw weight/length, etc...).
customer_reviews.author: Josh Brown

customer_reviews.title: I've had it OVER A YEAR NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This bow works great, I've had it over a year now. I shoot 70lbs and i shoot the crap out of it, about 100 arrows 4 to times a week. The only problem is sometimes the screws on the cams come loose which can be dangerous. But no damage, just inspect the bow before you shoot. I did the paint job myself, that's why it looks different.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Good Power
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bow - good power and quality, nice cams and ready for accessories. The only thing I didn't like was that the draw adjustment doesn't reduce weight significantly below the max until the adjustment screws are almost all the way out. My concern is that the bow might fail or incur damage at settings toward the lower end of the specified weight range.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good bow for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bow as a beginner bow to start hunting and it hasn't disappointed me. The quality is really good and the size is prefect. The only thing I would say could be better is a manual that actually shows how to set everything up. I had to search on youtube for half of the things on how to properly attach it.
customer_reviews.author: Fahad Jameel

customer_reviews.title: Great deal especially for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome great deal. Take it down to shop and get a nice sight and arrow rest have em put peep sight in and grab a nice release youll be in business. Even the other guys were impress by it abilties.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for sure
customer_reviews.text: Good bow for the money. Shoots great but Id recomend getting a new sight. The sight that comes with it is just fine but doesnt have a level. Its worth the xtra 15-30 bucks for a better sight. Would have been 5 stars but the string stop seems to be low quality. After just a hundred shots or so it became slightly damaged.
customer_reviews.author: The Northern Rebel

customer_reviews.title: A cheap bow that does't really hold up to basic light usage.  It's a shame because it seemed like a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: The first few times I used this bow I was impressed for the price that it was...then slowly but surely even with light usage just for target practice its started coming apart. The stabilizer stripped and broke off and the add on pieces did not stay very tight. Will definitely look into investing money in a higher quality bow next time since the basic pieces of this really only lasted a few weeks with very light use. I would not recommend this to anyone looking to get into Bow Hunting. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kane

customer_reviews.title: never shot it
customer_reviews.text: they seem like great beginner bows very sturdy good construction, my only issue is i can not for the life of me figure out how to adjust the draw weight and the item didnt come with a manual so ive never gotten to shoot it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea H.

customer_reviews.title: Budget Compound Bow shoots straight
customer_reviews.text: gave this bow a short try out- ultimately not a good fit for me. to be fair I did an extremely fast set up and shot about 50 arrows at about 15 yards finger pulled no sight @ 52.5# draw cheap stabilizer was only acc... my thoughts: 50-70# so not really what I consider a beginner...unless U are fairly strong. little heavy...kinda loud...but it shot straight! plenty of power! It’s not what i consider smooth...quiet or lite but U get what U pay for... For the price...it shot pretty damn straight considering the quick set up and no tune.
customer_reviews.author: C A

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: This bow for the price is def worth the buy. It shoots good but you will want some after market addons for sure. Peep sight, arrow rest and sight to name the main ones
customer_reviews.author: Shane Green

customer_reviews.title: Bow is of great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bow is of great quality for the price. The cams are easy to adjust for your particular draw length. Setup was easy as well. If you don't have $800 bucks to drop on a name brand bow this is your best bet for the money. Promise you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great bow, and has held up nicely. It was a gift for a tall teenager, and works great for him. It was a much better price than you’ll find in a sports store. We’ve bought several attachments and accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Grill master

customer_reviews.title: Faulty bow.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with this product, drawstring was so tight we couldn’t draw it even after Adjusting it per the instructions. Finally drew it back to fire an arrow and the string exploded. We took it to be restrung and the bow mechanic advised us to return it as nothing really lined up so it would never Fire safely. Hopefully this was just a one off bad bow.
customer_reviews.author: mr n p banwell

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: I bought it a couple of weeks ago. Ive shot it several times. Shoots extremely consistent. Once sighted in it has excellent groupings. You will want better sight, arrow rest. Wax the string immediately, I don't think its a quality string. Its a little on the heavy side, for me that's great. All in all i'm very happy, I would recommend it to anyone looking for a bow but doesn't want or have a lot of money to spend on one.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you know how to tune.
customer_reviews.text: Great bow for the money, if you know how to tune or have a pro to do it for you. The cams were totally out of sink. Although both sides were at full pull they were not equal. Cables were out of sink. Set screws for draw length will not stay in even with Blue Loctite. Finally had to use red Loctite and the upper screw worked loose in about 60 shots.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Trawick, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: You cannot get a better bow for the money!
customer_reviews.text: You cannot get a better bow for the money! Very little vibration out of the box, nice shooter. 5 stars except the string stop does not come with thread locker on it and after about 10 shots at 60lbs, the darn thing fell out; fixed the other night and expect to not have any further issues (used the red Locktite). The only other issue: weight. This is NOT a light bow, especially with any added accessories for quieting down the 'twang'.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE!!
customer_reviews.text: This is another of those 35 year ago updates. They have really improved compounds in the past decades. I LIKE!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Harris

customer_reviews.title: I would like to thank you very much for your product
customer_reviews.text: I would like to thank you very much for your product.. I love it ,This is a very well made product also not only looks good it performs Excellent!!! I receive My Package on time , It was package up very well, I am very happy with my purchase thank you very much highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: ANDRE

customer_reviews.title: You get a good basic bow set up
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I have had this bow for a year now and shot a lot of good groups with it. I recommend when you get the money make a few upgrades and it is a good affordable starter set.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Vaux

customer_reviews.title: Quality bow! Incredible price for the quality!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a nice bow without paying for the name brand price, this is the bow for you. I'm extremely impressed with the quality of this bow. It's acurate and it's well made. I would definitely buy another one of these if I needed it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The draw length adjustment screw comes off easily. Can't not find out the replacement screw..
customer_reviews.text: The bow is great for price/performance except the draw length screw coming out easily. Need to find out the replacement screw w/ lock nut or something...Still trying to figure how to do fix it..I only use it few times ...
customer_reviews.author: johnwin

customer_reviews.title: Great first time bow that will last
customer_reviews.text: I got this bow for my birthday, and man is it great! It came ready to shoot, you can adjust it very easily, and attachments are quickly installed. I swapped the rest and sights, and started grouping well from 60yards quickly. Since this is my first compound bow, I'm extremely pleased. I used it for bowfishing all summer, and plan to take it out for antelope, deer and elk next fall
customer_reviews.author: Derek E

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Broke twice on me Still wait for my return to be finalized
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and very powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a first bow! This is easy to adjust and works great. 70# is allot of power out of a bow so please buy a Target and arrows that can handle it. Used a drop away rest and riot release and tied my Owen D-loop. Not a backyard friendly trainer!
customer_reviews.author: Thomasajimenez1980

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bow a little over a month ago and the arms have already started to go bad. We are barely outside of the return date with a bow that is now unsafe to shoot. Do NOT buy this piece of junk. We had to replace the string in the first 2 weeks also. We have taken it to the shop from the beginning to make sure everything is being cared for properly. This SHOULD NOT be deteriorating so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm very easy to use well-made bow had a successful hunting season with it. I'm going to use it for this season I would definitely recommend this bow hands down
customer_reviews.author: Danielle fortugno

customer_reviews.title: Upset and disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Would love to give a better review but my bow was delivered and one arrow was missing the practice tip,didn't get string wax,release aid or peep sight as shown in picture. I hope they will make it right.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: It's a great bow I felt like sixteen opening your Christmas package
customer_reviews.text: My final review. A big thanks to leaders accessories for cutting the cast so that everyone can afford a bow. Many people would like to buy one but the price are too much, and the accessories are not in it yet. I take mine to the archery shop and got it set up and I must say it delivered a punch. I would recommend this bow to everyone. And also its not the prices are a expensive bow but the shooter. practice to become perfect and you will land on your hunt. Leader's accessories all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A.

customer_reviews.title: He says it is the best bow he has had
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he absolutely loves it. He says it is the best bow he has had. We had to add a few personalized accessories to the bow, but other than that he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: The bow would not draw and I couldn’t adjust the draw weight even with a pair of pliers on the allen key. It’s either defective or a very poor design, either way I’m returning it and ordering a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Rinat Lavi

customer_reviews.title: Much higher quality than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for fishing. The handle isn't the best but I have no complaints. I could totally take this thing deer hunting
customer_reviews.author: Bart Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bow for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good bow for the money. I got it as a present from my friends. + Well built + Durable + looks nice + holds adjustments well
customer_reviews.author: Karate fun

customer_reviews.title: These eliminate any reason not to bow hunt
customer_reviews.text: So I really am excited about this project I built 2 of these bows up for under 200 bucks have 2 guys using them this season they are on the money accurate and have a great hunting design no it's not a bow tech or Mathews but it will getter done no problem very fun project
customer_reviews.author: Slough Slaying

customer_reviews.title: Money Very Well Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I used this bow for the entire deer season. I absolutely love it! I did buy an upgrade sight, arrow rest, stabilizer, etc... but I can't find any issues with the bow quality itself thus far. I also really love the autumn cammo.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon G.

customer_reviews.title: Great bow. I ordered it for bowfishing and haven’t ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. I ordered it for bowfishing and haven’t had any problems yet I am impressed with the action it has and the accuracy. The only thing I could think of to improve it is weight reduction.but for the price you pay it’s 110% worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Zane phells

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: Definitely check all the screws in this before you use it. String broke on second use due to loss screw at draw length cam. And don't even bother with the accessories. Just go buy better ones. Bow itself is great
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money, defies the the rule, "you get what you pay for"
customer_reviews.text: great product for beginners or even experienced bow hunters with a tight budget. I shoot an expensive hoyte but bought this for my boy. I've shot this bow several times as well and it is not much slower than my hoyte. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: good bow, good price
customer_reviews.text: the bow is branded under the 'xgear' name, is very well made, and fit and finish are good. bow is very compact, a bit heavier than most of its' size, which i prefer. the slight extra weight helps with vibration and makes the bow a bit more durable and stable. would buy the bow again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A below-average bow
customer_reviews.text: This is a below-average bow. You are better off saving up for a PSE or a diamond
customer_reviews.author: bossco

customer_reviews.title: and so far it seems to be great. Haven’t shot anything else but it was easy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bow that I have purchased, and so far it seems to be great. Haven’t shot anything else but it was easy to set up and seems to shoot just fine. I would recommend for sure to someone whom has never shot a compound bow before
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, and they'll work with you if need be
customer_reviews.text: The bow shoots and stays where i set it.. Seems like a good buy for a beginning archer, persay, that can pull back the weight.. Came with with everything needed as well
customer_reviews.author: Shane Herman

customer_reviews.title: ok it is what it is
customer_reviews.text: ok it is what it is. a very nice STARTER bow light strong and pretty straightforward. my only regret wass buying the upgrade kit didn't know that arrow rest was plastic also but its hands down beater then the one that comes with iit. and I still replaced the peep sight with a better one
customer_reviews.author: dwayne

customer_reviews.title: I love this bow
customer_reviews.text: I love this bow, very easy to set the draw length and pull weight in a matter of a couple mins! its very light and short in stature to walk through brush with. I dont see any off the issues the nay sayers have been saying. Its really great especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Richard T. Gross

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service dept good bow
customer_reviews.text: Decent but string broke right away peep wasn't tied in properly....they have since sent a replacement string and peep very helpful and will buy more products from them
customer_reviews.author: Abby Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good one for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice fast bow, had to tighten all the hard wear after a few shots. Busted some brand new arrow fletches (pile drivers) because the bow has a semi narrow arrow rest throat and the fletchs would hit the grip as they passed through (and no they were not hitting the arrow rest). My biggest issue it tring to get replacement parts from Leader Accessories, the web site makes it seem like you are in poor luck. For now im not to worried but will have to let you know if/when i get details.
customer_reviews.author: Sam D.

customer_reviews.title: Brings back memories
customer_reviews.text: Great bow. Have not shot a bow in over 13 years. With this bow it make it so easy to pick up and go shoot. I bought different sights due to wanting more pins. Also i bought a new rest because I don't like the drop-away rest. Overall a very great quality bow. Cant wait till this fall to go Elk hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Michael David Schaper

customer_reviews.title: Overall great starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Directions were poor, but YouTube got it assembled. Arrows are not even good for practice target. Overall great starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: TMR

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level bow
customer_reviews.text: I would like to start out saying that I have been super happy with this bow, I am a beginner archer and a quality entry level bow is extremely nice. I will say the sight was not good so I replaced. The release feels cheap but so far hasn’t failed. Hope to arrow a whitetail this fall!
customer_reviews.author: Alex J

customer_reviews.title: great quiet bow.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The thing i like most about the bow is that it is sooo quiet.. The only thing that has been slightly irritating is that my sting dampener keeps loosening on me.
customer_reviews.author: Again

customer_reviews.title: Xmas gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a xmas gift for hubby he loved it just what he was looking for
customer_reviews.author: James mcgroarty

customer_reviews.title: Basically an improved SAS Rage 70 Lbs
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially the SAS rage except 4in shorter end to end. Which gets you an additional 40 fps, fantastic bow. If you like the SAS Rage then you will love this bow.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bow for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great starter bow for the money.. make sure string is waxed and check allen bolts and retighten maybe add blue thread locker after a few shots
customer_reviews.author: Bryon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for just starting out
customer_reviews.text: First bow I have ever owned. Perfect for just starting out. Definitely would recommend buying some upgrades like a new sight and arrow rest. Super glued my draw length setting due to some reviews but have had no issues to thus far. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kasburg

customer_reviews.title: Not Shabby
customer_reviews.text: Can’t beat the bow for the price (I purchased the bow only option), I would inform those interested that it did not come with a D-loop or peep sight. The pin sight that comes with the bow is cheap and you will need to upgrade but all in all it’ll get the job done. No issues with Cams, or String.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for beginners and expert shooters
customer_reviews.text: Great bow easy set up, smooth draw, the let off is awesome you can hold it back as long as you need, and shoots fast will probably buy another one for my wife
customer_reviews.author: robert michael maddox

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first shot
customer_reviews.text: Seemed really well made, but the string broke off on my first shot. I'm just glad it didn't hit me. Maybe the string could've been stronger? It said not to loosen more than 6 turns, so I did 4 full loosening turns on both ends. I'm not sure what the problem could be. Any help/tips on fixing this without going to a shop would be helpful, as I'm not sure of any near me anyway...
customer_reviews.author: Burnt Chrysler

customer_reviews.title: Great new bow for my 16 yr old son
customer_reviews.text: Bow is more than expected, right along with the arrows. Has an okay sight and an okay release. I am glad I came across to buying this package. This is a deal that can't be better!
customer_reviews.author: Butris

customer_reviews.title: String broke at the peep. Exploding the bow.
customer_reviews.text: My string broke at the peep after about 30 days exploding the bow. I do not have any sort of trust in this product after this. Scared the heck out of me and felt pretty dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: brenden broderick

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiancé as his 1st bow and he loves it. Definitely Recommend if it’s for a first time bow owner!
customer_reviews.author: meagan

customer_reviews.title: OUCH!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to shoot yet. After assembling I drew back to see what adjustments I would need to make on the draw and the string snapped.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect to rip it our of the box and have it be nothing to pull back. For an extremely strong 15yr old I had a pretty difficult time out of the box. Bout to go to my local shop and set the setting lower other than that great product
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hyka

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stop thinking about it and pull the trigger. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Los

customer_reviews.title: Great bow
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, item as described. Bow is very good. I'm using it for hunting now. I put an arrow rest bisquit on and different sight. Cant beat the value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Luis R.

customer_reviews.title: Good bow, a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: I shot a deer this year with this bow i have it set at 60 pounds and i have a 27” draw it is the best bow for its price. the only downside i feel is that this bow is a little bit too heavy. but besides that this bow is modern and a great hunting bow
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not bad
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good bow for the price, could not give it a 5 because it costs as much to set it up as the bow does. They need to sell a package deal
customer_reviews.author: TWA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner bow!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Shoots fantastic!!!! Dead aim at 40yrds and closer in the first day of shooting it. I got the bow bare bones and purchased my own accessories. Wonderful beginners bow. The price is perfect for beginners not trying to break the bank!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan b.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality on this bow
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality on this bow, I added a quiver and some carbon fiber arrows and this thing is a BEAST! Shoots strait and the accessories are all very nice and work perfect, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: S. Weir

customer_reviews.title: Good bow
customer_reviews.text: Nice bow, it was packed very well. The draw weight was at max 70 out of the box. Tried few shots, it has a lot of power!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bow for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hunting and recreational shooting and this bow performs just as well as most of mayor brand ones for a third of the price. Be mindful string wax is the key, hit it with wax before each use.
customer_reviews.author: zerius00015

customer_reviews.title: Yeah you should get it...
customer_reviews.text: A really great bow for how amazingly cheap it is. The bow shoots fantastically and is very adjustable for the poundage.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Gimenez

customer_reviews.title: So far I have loved the bow
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it to try and get into bow hunting. So far I have loved the bow. With a little extra in it for better sights and arrow rest it has been a great bow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Was really impressed with the draw cycle and let off .... only complaint was the arrows are for recurve bow and very bent ... when fired the nock broke on the first shot but the bow was unexpectedly nice for its price
customer_reviews.author: Alan estill

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew, after set up he's shooting 1 1/2" groups after two days shooting
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Good starter bow
customer_reviews.text: It is a really good starter bow. It's a little tricky to adjust the draw weight, but besides that it's a good bow. It doesn't come with anything except the bow and the string so everything else must be purchased separately.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Cahill

customer_reviews.title: Spouse loves
customer_reviews.text: Got husband an archery lesson for birthday, he enjoyed it, so I bought him this. He uses it a few times a week and likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Evergreenjamie

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!
customer_reviews.text: If your a beginner or an expert this bow is flawless. The price is unbeatable as well so happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bow. Very versatile for adults. Highly recommend to others
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Scott Zigler

customer_reviews.title: Compound bow
customer_reviews.text: Broke two strings and lost peep sights. Can't seem to figure out why it keeps breaking strings.
customer_reviews.author: Lonny Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Pictures do not do it justice, would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Great for our teenager loves the color it fits boys and girls alike.
customer_reviews.author: Honey3358

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: They is a great buy for the price. The bow is a bit heavier than the big names but definitely worth the price. All accessories that come with the bow are great. Only issue is the draw length increments are 1in. Take to a local shop for set up!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

product_meta.title: Leader Accessories Compound Bow 50-70lbs 25" - 31" Archery Hunting Equipment with Max Speed 310fps, Right Handed
feature_bullets: Hand Orientation: Right. Draw Weight: 50 - 70 lbs. Draw Length: 25" - 31".
Max Speed: 310 FPS. Let Off: 75% - 80%. Axle to Axle: 31.5". Brace Height: 7.5". Weight: 4.4 lbs.
Aluminum Riser. Adjust the draw weight and draw length with enclosed Allen Wrench. No bow press is needed.
1-Year Warranty on the bow excluding string & cables. 30" Carbon arrow and 30" Aluminum arrow recommended for this compound bow.
